verses.verse: And on the day, the third one, a wedding happened in Cana, Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there.
Jesus and His students were also invited to the wedding.
And when wine was lacking, the mother of Jesus says to Him, "They do not have wine."
Jesus says to her, "What is there between Me and you, ma'am? My hour has not arrived yet."
His mother says to the servants, "Whatever He says to you, do."
There were six stone water pots lying there according to the cleansing of the Jewish people having a capacity of two or three measurers (18 or 27 gallons) apiece.
Jesus says to them, "Fill the water pots full of water." And they filled them full up to the top.
And He says to them, "Draw it out now, and carry it to the head waiter." And they carried it to him.

As the head waiter tasted the water that had become wine and did not realize where it is from (but the servants who had drawn out the water realized where it was from), the head waiter hollers for the groom.
And he says to him, "Every person puts the nice wine out first, and when they are drunk, then the lesser wine. You have kept the nice wine until now."
This beginning of the indicators Jesus did in Cana, Galilee. And He showed His magnificence, and His students trusted in Him.
After this, He, His mother, His brothers, and His students walked down to Capernaum. And they did not stay there many days.
And the Passover of the Jewish people was near, and Jesus walked up to Jerusalem.
And He found on the temple grounds the people selling cattle, sheep, and doves, and the small change dealers sitting.

And after making a whip from ropes, He threw all of them out of the temple grounds (even the sheep and the cattle), spilled out the small change of the currency exchangers, and turned over the tables.
And He said to the people selling the doves, "Take these things out of here. Do not make the house of My Father a house of merchandise."
His students remembered that it is a thing that has been written, (in Psalm 69:9) "The passion of Your house ate me up."
So the Jewish people responded and said to Him, "What indicator do You show us because You are doing these things?"
Jesus answered and said to them, "Break down this temple and in three days I will raise it up."
So the Jewish people said, "In forty and six years, this temple was built, and you in three days will raise it up?"
But that Jesus was talking about the temple of His body.
So when He got up from the dead, His students remembered that He was saying this to them, and they trusted in the Old Testament writing and in the message that Jesus told.
As He was in Greater Jerusalem during the Passover, many in the festival trusted in His name as they watched His indicators that He was doing.
But Jesus Himself was not trusting Himself to them because of the fact for Him to be knowing everyone
and because He did not have a need that someone might tell what he witnessed about the person. You see, He knew what was in the person.
